"...So then, Zephetto's...": "What're you up to?"
"What are you two talking about?"
"Oh, I just was asking Crawford about Zephetto."
"Just talking a bit about Zephetto."

"Like what exactly
Zephetto was doing here on Halpha."

"I figured if we knew that, it might lead
to a hint in our fight against the Starless."

"We've uncovered much of his intel
thanks to our talks with the Lecielans."

"It's just, there's so much data to go
over that it'll take a while to analyze it all."
"It's 500 years worth of intelligence, after all."
"What's more, not many of those documents remain on Halpha."
"So he's really been at this for that long?"
"That sounds pretty overwhelming."

"Judging by the data,
there's little doubt about it."
"It certainly is."

"First, what we do know is
that he wasn't always a Cast."

"As his activities became prolonged, it seems that he
had his body mechanized to extend his lifespan."
"...He went that far..."
"Aye. He dedicated everything for his experiment."

"...At first, it seems the experiments on Halpha
did take safety and security into account."
"But, it didn't produce enough results for him."

"Before long, the DOLLS were being manufactured, and the
experiment changed to focus more on live combat."

"And then, the most significant results came when
Dark Falz was introduced to the experiment."

"By overcoming a life-threatening battle
with an overwhelmingly powerful enemy..."

"The surviving ARKS would rapidly
undergo significant Photon attenuation."

"And then, we were forced to
fight Dark Falz as well..."

"Personally, my emotions won't allow me
to forgive Zephetto for what he's done."

"But, I can also somewhat
understand his sentiment."

"Because I too seek to do
all that I can as Aelio's leader."

"I would do anything for the
good of the people of Aelio."

"...Of course, I wouldn't go about it
with methods like his, though."

"...\"I've accomplished what I set out to do.\"
That was one of the last things he said."

"If that's true, then we should have
some means of fighting the Starless."
"...And I most certainly hope it is."
